intro: Mitranthes castellanosii, commonly known as the Castellanos' bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
